attributes.comment:
Adoption is an expensive process and naturally every agency that deals with the
many applications, forms, information requests, etc. has a right to be
compensated for those services, However, the majority of adoptive parents are
not wealthy; they are inviting an otherwise homeless child into their home with not
much else to offer than unconditional love and the peace a family can give. I know
of many potential adoptive parents who take out loans and charge most of the
expenses on credit. Many adoptive parents already have had their savings
depleted due to the high cost of fertility treatments that are not covered by
insurance....JUST TO BRING A CHILD INTO THEIR LIVES.

The federal government legitimizes adoption by offering a tax credit to adoptive
parents. The effects of the proposed fee increases, along with adoption agency
fee increases and out-of-country fee increases, practically negates this credit and
would simply make adoption unaffordable to many people.

I understand the need to increase fees, but not by 50% or more. Be reasonable
and fair to the good people who open their homes to children in need of family.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Deborah DeBraal
